title: Riot, didn't you remove DFG because you didn't want to balance Champions around an item?
body:
If that's the case, can you tell me why you go ahead and introduce Cinderhulk and, when it predictably pushes Sejuani over the edge because she benefits way too much from it, immediately bring the nerf hammer down?

Sejuani has been fine without nerfs for literally years - and now, instead of just nerfing Cinderhulk or her interaction with it, she gets nerfs across the board because of one possible build path. This shits on every Sejuani player who doesn't play her in the jungle. It shits on every Sejuani player that plays her on Dominion or ARAM. It shits on every Sejuani players that doesn't build Cinderhulk for whatever reason.

*She gets balanced around one build path, in one role, on one map*. What a great balancing philosophy. This is so much fun for long time Sej players.

There's always so much big talk about Champion diversity, and how the possibility to play a Champ in different roles and with builds should be preserved... but knee jerk nerfs like these show that it's all just empty phrases that lose their meaning the moment when balancing would be more challenging than giving out flat nerfs to all outliers.

>Why nerf an item that helps this many tanky junglers? easier to just hit 1 champ.

Because it's lazy and not at all in line with the design philosophy Riot, according to themselves, adheres to.
Apart from that, there are changes that would be much more effective at reducing her synergy with Cinderhulk, *without* interfering with her overall strength. Why not just nerf the health scaling on her W? It would reduce her overall AoE damage with Cinderhulk as well as the benefit she gain from the health passive. The nerf to her W is made up by the buff to her E, atleast on squishier targets. 
And the slow reduction on her ultimate doesn't change much. You don't ever aim to slow, you aim to stun and the slow is incidental. Plus, you still have Permafrost to follow up with.

It's not that she's being gutted, it's that within literally a week of finally enjoying a moderate win rate Sej gets the nerf bat while champs like Nid, Lee, Zed, etc. are consistently problematic and hated vehimently by the community...and I think collectively have gotten maybe four nerfs in any capacity in the last year and a half.

Zed and Lee are, I suspect, just being hated on for the sake of being hated on. I believe that its generally understood that they're not quite as OP as people like to make them out to be. Yes, they're strong. But they're not THAT strong.
And Nidalee has FINALLY had a chance to shine since she settled down after her rework, give her a break. She used to be trash tier before they let her jungle. She couldn't go top, bruisers laughed her out of lane. She had trouble in mid, mages had a field day with her (when they had mana...). And of course, she couldn't even consider bot lane.
A 'nerf' like this is pretty acceptable. I'd be more surprised if they didn't go after other tanky junglers too. Its not just her, its the class that finally FINALLY rose up. And now we remember why they were kept weak. XD

"Finally?" What are you, high? Nid has ALWAYS been a problem, and she's ALWAYS excelled in a truly ludicrous number of roles. She was a strong support due to her ridiculous harassment potential, map awareness, and her strong heal, she was a strong mid laner due to her absolutely insane nuking potential, she was a strong bruiser in the jungle or top lane in cat form, and shit, because her heal has an AS steroid she was even a decent ADC.

Nidalee has never *not* been strong *somewhere*.

Ok, I generally agree with your post, but let's not act like *those* things really were strong.
Well... "Bot lane next to an ADC Nid was strong" doesn't have quite the same ring to it.

"Support" Nid was strong for a while, in the sense that she could play and win bot lane with an ADC

Although whether she ever *actually* supported her ADC is debatable

More of a poke>kill lane really, and it definitely worked, it just received a lot of bad rep because *most* of the people who played her as support where the people who just wanted to carry but mid was taken. A strong heal as well as crazy harass and zoning is pretty much the same general style as Nami, but instead of a lot of CC followup, Nidalee had an AS steroid and kill potential to followup on her harass.

I can't hate Zed since he has been my main for more than a year and I love his thematic (yes, I started playing him because of his theme and not because OMG OP). But still, I think Zed is not OP, but he's too powerful and needs some tuning down.

And when I talk about Zed and use him as a reference of someone that RIOT doesn't want to nerf even if he deserves it, I don't do it because "I hate him". I do it because I think so.

Highest win rate in game, and had a 52% win rate before the patch, as well as tripling her pick and ban rate. She was strong before this patch, and like any blanket buff or nerf, there will always be outliers that need special attention to get in line with every other champ in the roster.

Other than directly out of your ass, where are you getting these numbers?

Currently looking at lolking, and from what I can tell, before V5.5 her win rate was 55.4% and her pick rate was just under 9%. She's currently at 58% for win rate and 13% for her pick rate. Now, I'm no mathematician, but I don't think that 13 is three times 9. More like... 1.5 times.

And again, my point isn't "Sejuani is perfectly balanced right now!" It's that Riot needs to get off their asses and solve the deeply rooted, consistent problems before they lay the nerf bat down on someone on a potentially extraordinarily short lived upswing. Yes, Sej just got a rather nice indirect buff in the form of Cinderhulk and the lower intensity of the jungle mobs. She's also winning a lot because *people don't know how to counter her.*

This would be like Riot nerfing Vel'Koz after a patch made an item that benefited immobile spammy casters and everyone forgot how to deal with him while leaving Zed or LeBlanc alone despite the frustration they cause.

Balance should be made with consistent data, and *you cannot get consistent data while a patch is barely a week old.*

I was referring to her winrate statistics from the last several days as seen in her personal stat page on LoLking.com. I was looking a little farther back and have been tracking her stats since she showed up in LCS, and in the past ~4ish weeks, she has gone from around 52% win rate (it may have been more in the 53% range) and a 4-5% pick rate to what she has now. The fact that her win and pick rate are still *increasing* shows that she was strong already and is still not as strong as she can possibly be. In 5.4 I think is when her pick rate jumped up to around 8% and her win rate got to 54-55%, because J4 got nerfs and that forced players to look for alternatives, and they realized how good Sej was. 5.5 rolls around and suddenly she goes up in pick and win rate by another good chunk, which is still increasing ever so slightly. I don't think she is OP because of Cinderhulk, I think she is OP right now because of several gradual changes that have been there for a while, just that people are only realizing because they are all thinking "huh, tanks got buffed lets try Sejuani... WOW she is good!". Cinder hulk didn't make her particularly broken or oppressive, just *noticed* for what she was already becoming.

Not quite.  Riot didn't like what happened to champion designs when you balanced them around DFG.  It's a specific complaint about balancing around that item, not items in general.

There are some other examples of this in the past:

* Bloodthirster had a tendency to end lanes, because you'd both deal more and take less.  Riot opted to nerf it into a more utility sort of item, and refocus on the all-offense IE or TF as the starting items.
* Heart of Gold promoted passive snowballing, where a top laner who took first blood would immediately back for the gp10 and then just sit on his lead.  
* Force of Nature made it feasible for tank champions to trivialize heavy AP comps.  Too much resist combined with too much regen made AP poke champions feel pointless.

* Innervating Locket allowed champions with low-CD kits sustain themselves pretty much infinitely, the most infamous abusers being Sona and Udyr
* Aegis of the Legion (the old version, ~1900 gold, HP/Armor/MR/AD item) and Runic Bulwark (its upgrade item that was removed from the game) were generically tanky item options that made it too easy for tanks, bruisers and even supports.
